content: hip to be square socks by caroline crescenzi// prrlgrrl about the hip to be square socks are cuff down with heel flap and gusset construction the pattern uses simple slip stitching to create a repeating grid motif notes and materials sizes s m l / 56 64 72 stitches yarn 100g/460 yards fingering weight yarn optional contrast heel and toe color needles us1/2 25mm circular needle with 32 cable or dpns gauge approx 8 st per inch in stockinette notions stitch markers and tapestry needle stitch glossary and abbreviations k - knit p - purl sl - slip_stitch purlwise with yarn in back unless otherwise noted k2tog - knit 2 stitches together p2tog - purl 2 stitches together ssk - slip slip knit slip 2 stitches knitwise one at a time then knit the 2 slipped stitches together tips to replicate pop of color on the cuff see this video from crazy sock lady crazy sock lady -
